name: places/ChIJK-1O-lBfwokRKEn4pRaZXhw
formattedAddress: Robert F. Kennedy Bridge, New York, NY 10035, USA
adrFormatAddress: Robert F. Kennedy Bridge, New York, NY 10035, USA

editorialSummary.text: Landmark 1930s road & pedestrian bridge system with panoramic city views, illuminated at night.

originalText.text: I like this bridge and the design of it. On the drive coming down from the north to NYC, this is one of the best bridges to cross. The ride is very smooth and you get a good view of the city.

text.text: I like this bridge and the design of it. On the drive coming down from the north to NYC, this is one of the best bridges to cross. The ride is very smooth and you get a good view of the city.

originalText.text: The walking experience is certainly interesting. Not nearly enough space, no guard rails on the highest part of the bridge, and there’s a large gap in the walking path that items could easily slip through. Other than that, though, the views are gorgeous, and it’s one of the only bridges where you can easily see 4 boroughs at once. Overall enjoyable, definitely better than the Manhattan Bridge.

originalText.text: I love this toll bridge. They had toll booths years ago but they removed all the booths now and it is a easy ride with  less traffic. Triboro bridge connects Astoria Queens to the Bronx and the ride is not bad these days compare to when they had toll booths. This bridge has been good to me because it allowed me avoid driving from the Bronx through Manhattan and take the 59th street bridge to Queens with all that traffic.

text.text: I love this toll bridge. They had toll booths years ago but they removed all the booths now and it is a easy ride with  less traffic. Triboro bridge connects Astoria Queens to the Bronx and the ride is not bad these days compare to when they had toll booths. originalText.text: Once upon a time, around 2013 a vibrant young adventurer who prided herself on having walked every single walkable bridge in New York City discovered that the spectacular triboro bridge was indeed walkable too! It took a few tries to figure out how exactly to access the bridge from her beloved Astoria because its entrance is right smack in the middle of a busy road and not exactly grand. But that’s exactly why she loved it. Its not as pretty as the Queensboro Bridge or as colorful as the Billyburg Bridge or as new as the K bridge. Its not as majestic as the Brooklyn Bridge nor as exciting as the vivacious Manhattan Bridge. And it certainly wasn’t the busiest bridge in the world like the GW. Oh no, not busy in the least- it took her from quaint cozy Astoria to even sleepier Randalls Island and it felt like a secret. Because many times she was the only one on the walkway and in a city of 9 million, solitude is a rare treat. Its the only bridge that doesn’t have a barrier over the water and that too felt precious and secretive. And ever since then she’d walk to the middle of bridge so she could look over at her beautiful home and understand that she could never truly know her city. And yet she continues to try…

originalText.text: Omggg the GREATEST WALK IN NYC. A SECRET EXPERIENCE.  U haven't lived till u walk this bridge walkway. Its long and u can see the people playing in park from over 2000 feet in air. Omg its scary but exhilarating.  I wish I cud walk the whole bridge with a GF or friend cus its so romantic and takes like 1 to 2 hours to walk from Randall's Island entrance to astoria queens. U haven't enjoyed nyc if u haven't walked this bridge. During the day it's beautiful especially in spring or summer. This is the secret spot of nyc. Hopefully tourist don't find out cus its such an amazing exp. It's free also to walk it. Feels like ur flying above earth . So much Goin on during walk. Hopefully someone reads this and enjoys the same walk that I took. Greatest place to exp nyc.
